alert.note: Alert for Reynolds (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:06AM CST until December 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River near Annapolis. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Annapolis. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, County Road 372 will begin flooding near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM CST Saturday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Black River Annapolis 8.0 8.2 Sat 5 am 5.2 4.0 3.7 3.7 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
